properties.name: Hegra (Mada'in Salih)
properties.description: Saudi Arabia's first UNESCO site. 110+ Nabataean tombs carved into sandstone - the largest preserved site south of Petra. World's Leading Cultural Tourism Project 2025.

properties.name: AlUla Old Town
properties.description: Ancient oasis town with 900+ mudbrick houses, labyrinthine alleys, and the Maraya mirrored concert hall. Gateway to Hegra.

properties.name: Elephant Rock
properties.description: Iconic 52-meter natural sandstone formation resembling an elephant. Best at sunset with caf√© and stargazing.

properties.name: Wadi Al Disah
properties.description: Stunning sandstone canyon in Tabuk region. Towering red cliffs, palm-filled valley, natural springs. Called 'Valley of the Palms'.

properties.name: Edge of the World
properties.description: Dramatic 300m escarpment cliffs overlooking endless desert. Popular sunset hike 90km from Riyadh. Part of ancient Tethys seabed.

properties.name: Diriyah At-Turaif
properties.description: UNESCO World Heritage birthplace of Saudi Arabia. Mudbrick palaces in traditional Najdi architecture. Free entry, easy day trip from Riyadh.

properties.name: Jeddah Al-Balad
properties.description: UNESCO historic district with traditional Hijazi coral-stone tower houses, wooden mashrabiya windows, and ancient souks.

properties.name: Al Ahsa Oasis
properties.description: UNESCO World Heritage - largest oasis in the world. 30,000 acres of date palms, ancient irrigation, and cave formations.

properties.name: Rijal Almaa
properties.description: 900-year-old stone village in Asir mountains. Colorful painted tower houses clinging to cliffs, 50km from Abha.
